newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian border guards open fire on foreign ship.
newsitem.headline: Russian border guards open fire on foreign ship.

text.p: Russian border guards on Thursday fired on a foreign cargo ship trying to leave the Black Sea port of Novorossiisk without permission, the press service of the border guard troops said.
The press service statement did not say if any crew members aboard the freighter Imia were injured. The ship was registered at the Greek port of Piraeus, the statement added.
The statement said the freighter, sailing under the Panamian flag with a crew of 17 Ukrainians and one Tanzanian, tried to leave Russia's territorial waters without customs or border checks.
A Russian border guard ship contacted the vessel and ordered it to stop but the Imia ignored the command.
After a warning salvo the commander of the border guard ship ordered direct shots fired.
"The cargo ship stopped and the captain made contact," the border guards added, without saying what happened to the ship afterwards.
